metadata.feature_description: Manage the primary/home article for the wiki module

steps.expected: Wiki page loads with primary article displayed
steps.actual: Wiki page loaded successfully showing the primary article at the top of the page

steps.action: Verify primary article content is visible
steps.expected: Primary article content should be displayed prominently
steps.actual: Primary article displayed with content: 'Welcome to the Wiki front page! This is the primary article for the Wiki module. Updated by Claude on January 9, 2026 for Primary Article Management testing.'

steps.action: Click Edit link on primary article
steps.expected: Edit dialog should open for primary article
steps.actual: Edit dialog opened successfully showing content editor

steps.action: Verify edit dialog has appropriate fields
steps.expected: Dialog should show Content field and action buttons (Cancel, Delete, Publish)
steps.actual: Edit dialog displayed with Content field (textarea), Cancel button, Delete button, and Publish button

steps.action: Verify edit dialog for primary article does not show title field
steps.expected: Title field should be hidden for primary articles (uses module title instead)
steps.actual: Title field is not displayed in the edit dialog for primary article. The edit dialog only shows the Content field. Code confirms: '<!-- ko ifnot: primaryArticle -->' wraps the title input field

steps.action: Verify Edit button is visible for moderator/admin user
steps.expected: Edit button should be visible for users with moderation permissions
steps.actual: Edit link is visible on the primary article section. Logged in as SuperUser Account (host) which has moderator permissions. Code confirms: Edit button is rendered when CanModerate is true

observations: Primary article uses module title instead of a separate title field - confirmed by code: '<!-- ko ifnot: primaryArticle -->' conditional around title input
Primary articles do not have Tags field - also hidden by the same conditional
Delete button is only shown for existing primary articles (articleId > 0)
The 'Create Front Article' link only appears when no primary article exists AND user has moderation permissions

Set primary article and Change primary article scenarios were not tested separately as the system already had a primary article configured, and these operations require the same Edit functionality that was successfully tested
